publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3047# Johann Lamont: Youth Disorder and Support to Communities—That the Parliament congratulates local people in Cardonald, throughout the Glasgow Pollok constituency, across Glasgow and Scotland-wide for their commitment to maintaining communities which are safe and secure places to live; acknowledges that the problems of youth disorder must be given a high priority if the right to peace and security at home and in the community is to be protected; believes that the rights of the victims of community disorder must be at the centre of any initiatives on legislation to tackle the problem; recognises the importance of ensuring that the children's panel and justice systems are sufficiently robust to show young people and their parents that there are real consequences to such behaviour, and considers that the Scottish Executive and the appropriate committees of the Parliament, working with local government, the police, youth services and other relevant organisations, should develop action to support communities.
S1M-3047# Youth Disorder and Support to Communities (lodged on 29 April 2002) Bill Butler*, Mr Jamie Stone*
S1M-3047# Youth Disorder and Support to Communities (lodged on 29 April 2002) Sarah Boyack*, Mr Duncan McNeil*
S1M-3047# Youth Disorder and Support to Communities (lodged on 29 April 2002) Janis Hughes*, Donald Gorrie*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Bill Aitken*

S1M-3047# Johann Lamont: Youth Disorder and Support to Communities—That the Parliament congratulates local people in Cardonald, throughout the Glasgow Pollok constituency, across Glasgow and Scotland-wide for their commitment to maintaining communities which are safe and secure places to live; acknowledges that the problems of youth disorder must be given a high priority if the right to peace and security at home and in the community is to be protected; believes that the rights of the victims of community disorder must be at the centre of any initiatives on legislation to tackle the problem; recognises the importance of ensuring that the children's panel and justice systems are sufficiently robust to show young people and their parents that there are real consequences to such behaviour, and considers that the Scottish Executive and the appropriate committees of the Parliament, working with local government, the police, youth services and other relevant organisations, should develop action to support communities. Supported by: Bill Butler, Mr Jamie Stone, Sarah Boyack, Mr Duncan McNeil, Janis Hughes, Donald Gorrie, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Bill Aitken, Phil Gallie*, David Mundell*, Mr Brian Monteith*, Mr Keith Harding*, Ian Jenkins*
S1M-3047# Youth Disorder and Support to Communities (lodged on 29 April 2002) Susan Deacon*, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*
S1M-3047# Youth Disorder and Support to Communities (lodged on 29 April 2002) Marilyn Livingstone*
S1M-3047# Youth Disorder and Support to Communities (lodged on 29 April 2002) Nora Radcliffe*
S1M-3047# Youth Disorder and Support to Communities (lodged on 29 April 2002) Cathy Peattie*
S1M-3047# Youth Disorder and Support to Communities (lodged on 29 April 2002) Irene Oldfather*, Dr Sylvia Jackson*
S1M-3047# Youth Disorder and Support to Communities (lodged on 29 April 2002) Brian Fitzpatrick*
S1M-3047# Youth Disorder and Support to Communities (lodged on 29 April 2002) Cathie Craigie*
